body.p:
EXECUTIVE DEPARTMENT,
Frankfort, Ky., July 1st, 1862.
Hon O P Hogan
Dear Sir:

All I can say to you in answer to your letter is that under the laws and Constitution of both State and Nation as expounded by the Courts the people have a right to become candidates got to the polls and vote for such persons as they may choose, for their agents to carry out their will -- This is the basis of our Republcan institutions as heretofore acknowledged by all parties, and I cannot beleive that any one especially those who say they Stand up for the "Constitution the Union and the enforcement of the laws" -- will by force attempt to violate this principle^*^ I Take it for granted that the threat you spoke of is unauthorized -- from the practice you mention and made by interested parties to frighten the people from the polls --

Respectfully Your friend & Obedient Servant
B Magoffin --
N. B.*I have not as you are aware a soldier or a dollar to enforce the laws or protect the people in their rights under the Constitution --

A copy Attest Nat Gaither Jr
Secy of State
Copy of letter to O, P, Hogan
